'''Corphish''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ヘイガニ''' ''Heigani'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Crawdaunt}} starting at [[level]] 30.

==Biology==
Corphish is a red-shelled, crustacean Pokémon with a short tail similar to a lobster. Its eyes are saucer-like with small pupils, and it has three spikes on top of its head. It possesses four pairs of limbs in total: two large pincers used for gripping prey, and three pairs of legs used for walking. The upper segments of its legs, underside of its body and lower halves of its pincers are cream-colored. 

A hardy creature, Corphish is able to live in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Water's-edge Pokémon|polluted water}} and eat nearly anything. Though not native to [[Alola]], Corphish set free by Trainers here have easily adapted and thrived in the region. {{p|Feebas}} and Corphish are the only Pokémon known to be able to live in stagnant ditches.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Corphish.png|250px|left|thumb|Corphish in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Corphish]]====
A Corphish appeared in ''[[AG023|Gone Corphishin']]''. {{Ash}} battled and captured this Ruffian Pokémon at the end of the episode. [[Ash's Corphish]] serves as the main comic relief of Ash's [[party|team]] and the only Pokémon that Ash captured in [[Hoenn]] that hasn't evolved.

====Other====
Corphish debuted in ''[[AG021|Which Wurmple's Which?]]''. Ash caught it on his fishing line and it subsequently attacked him and {{ashfr}}.

A Corphish appeared in the ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]'' and ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]''. He was one of the two Pokémon (the other being {{mdc|Chatot|2}}) who kicked Team Razor Wind out of their guild.

A Corphish appeared in ''[[DP112|Cheers on Castaways Isle!]]'', where it was shown stacking the rocks around a glowing jewel which turns out to be a {{p|Deoxys}}.

A Corphish appeared in ''[[PK24|Meloetta's Moonlight Serenade]]''.

A Corphish was caught by [[Soren and Rocko|Rocko]] in ''[[BW099|A Surface to Air Tag Battle Team!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A Corphish appeared in ''[[DP147|Bagged Then Tagged!]]''.

A Corphish appeared in a flashback in ''[[XY040|Day Three Blockbusters!]]''.

A Corphish appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Tierno Corphish Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Corphish in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
{{main|Ash's Corphish}}
{{Ash}} owns a Corphish in the [[Ash & Pikachu]] manga.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Corphish was first seen being used by [[Team Aqua]] to attack {{adv|Ruby}} and {{adv|Sapphire}} at the [[Seafloor Cavern]] in ''[[PS243|No Armaldo Is an Island]]''.

The Battle Factory rented a Corphish which was stolen by [[Guile Hideout]] in ''[[PS334|The Final Battle VII]]''.

In ''[[PS526|Mr. Perfect]]'', the {{adv|Magician}} was seen with a Corphish that helps delivers equipment to {{adv|Blake}}.

{{Adv|Tierno}} owns a Corphish. It first appeared in ''[[PAXY01|An X-cuse to Come Out and Play]]''.

===In the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blazing Exploration Team manga===
Corphish appeared in [[BET2]] as part of [[List of Wigglytuff's Guild members|Wigglytuff's Guild members]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Corphish appeared in ''[[PMRS39|Pokémon New Year]]'' of the [[Pokémon Ruby-Sapphire]] manga.

==Trivia==
*Corphish is the only Pokémon to date with a [[catch rate]] of 205.
*Corphish can be found in the Hoenn region, but it says in its Pokédex entries that it came from another region overseas. This would make it the first exotic species in the Pokémon world.
*Corphish's tendency to say "Hey, hey!" in such games as [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness]] and [[PokéPark Wii: Pikachu's Adventure]] is a reference to its Japanese name, "Heigani".

===Origin===
Based on its {{game|Ruby and Sapphire|s|Ruby}} Pokédex entry, Corphish is probably based on the {{wp|red swamp crayfish}}.

====Name origin====
Corphish may be a combination of ''{{wp|corps}}'' (a branch of military servicemen; pronounced as ''core'') or ''{{wp|corporal}}'' (a member of the military or police force) and ''{{wp|crayfish}}'' (the species it is based on). Alternatively, it could derive from the archaic Newfoundland fishing term ''corfish'', which are a type of dried fish.

Heigani is a combination of 弊 ''hei'' (''a bad habit'' or ''to harm'') or 兵 ''hei'' (army/troops) and ''ebigani'' (crayfish).
